acf.main_content_item_1_text:
Executive Director and CEO, World Education Services
Mariam Assefa has been the Executive Director and CEO of World Education Services (WES) since 1982. She served as the 2006 President of NAFSA: Association of International Educators. In 2005 she was awarded Metro International’s Fulbright Award for Contribution to International Education Exchange. Assefa is active in inter­national education and exchange. Mariam frequently presents on foreign educational systems and the recognition of international educational credentials at conferences and workshops worldwide.
acf.main_content_item_2_text:
Deputy Director of World Education Services and Director WES Canada
Tim Owen is a Deputy Director of World Education Services, and he has served as the Director of WES Canada since its inception in 2000. Owen has a long history working on immigrant settlement, credential recognition issues, and a career in the not for profit sector that spans forty years. He is a member of many advisory groups related to this work including the Consultative Committee for the Office of the Fairness Commission of Ontario, the Conference Board of Canada’s Leaders Roundtable on Immigration, and the Toronto Region Immigrant Employment Council.
acf.main_content_item_3_text:
Deputy Executive Director for Global Talent Policy and Programs
As the Director of WES Global Talent Bridge, Paul Feltman develops outreach and education programs, community partnerships and policy initiatives focused on helping immigrants successfully integrate into academic and professional settings. He serves as the steering committee chair of IMPRINT, a coalition of organizations active in the field of immigrant professional integration. Paul also serves on the advisory board of the Massachusetts New Americans Integration Institute and the National Blue Rib-bon Panel of the Community College Consortium for Immigrant Education
acf.main_content_item_4_text:
Deputy Executive Director, CFO
Lisa Connors is Chief Financial Officer and Deputy Executive Director of World Education Services. She has been with the organization since 2010 in various roles in finance and production.  Lisa serves on the Board and chairs the Audit Committee of the Westchester Community College Foundation.  She holds an MBA from the Darden School of Business at the University of Virginia.
acf.main_content_item_5_text:
Deputy Executive Director, Core Services
Steve is responsible for the strategic direction and operation of WES’ revenue-based services.  In this capacity, he focuses on the evaluation service, new business development, strategy, and business innovation. Steve is a seasoned executive with a strong track record achieved in a career spent in major education sector companies. He spent many years at Pearson Education, most recently as Senior Vice President, Business Development and Innovation. Steve also teaches at the School of Professional Studies at New York University and at the New York Institute of Finance.

leadership_rows.profile_position: CEO and Executive Director, World Education Services
leadership_rows.profile_text: Esther T. Benjamin has been a global executive in the public, private, and civil society sectors for more than 25 years. Before joining WES as CEO and executive director, Esther worked with Laureate Education, Inc., a leading global higher education organization. Esther served as the Associate Director for Global Operations of the U.S. Peace Corps, and held senior management roles with the International Youth Foundation and the International Partnership for Microbicides.

leadership_rows.profile_position: Managing Director Canada and Deputy Executive Director
leadership_rows.profile_text: Shamira Madhany joined WES in 2018 after more than two decades of public service. She has extensive experience working with licensing bodies, settlement agencies, and higher education and post-secondary sectors in Ontario. She served as the chief architect of several government programs that enable highly skilled immigrants to obtain employment in their fields. Shamira played a key role in the launch of WES Canada in 2000 during her tenure at the Ontario Ministry of Citizenship and Immigration as Provincial Lead, Access to Professions and Trades.

leadership_rows.profile_position: Deputy Executive Director for Global Talent Policy and Programs
leadership_rows.profile_text: As Deputy Executive Director for Global Talent Policy and Programs for WES, Paul Feltman oversees the WES Global Talent Bridge Program and develops outreach and education programs, community partnerships, and policy initiatives focused on helping immigrants successfully integrate into academic and professional settings. He serves as the steering committee chair of IMPRINT, a coalition of organizations active in the field of immigrant professional integration. Paul also serves on the advisory board of the Massachusetts New Americans Integration Institute and the National Blue Rib­bon Panel of the Community College Consortium for Immigrant Education.

Cheryl Cramer Toto has spent over two decades in operational leadership and business transformation in the private sector and with non-profit organizations. Before joining WES as COO Cheryl served as President and CEO of the Marketing Science Institute. Cheryl also spent ten years at Houghton Mifflin Harcourt where she helped to turn a paper-based educational publishing house into one of the sector’s digital pioneers.

Monica Munn joined WES in 2019, bringing over a decade of experience leading social impact and economic development initiatives in the philanthropic, social enterprise, and private sectors. Monica oversees WES’ philanthropic initiatives, including the WES Mariam Assefa Fund, funding partnerships, and corporate philanthropy. Previously, Monica held several positions at the Rockefeller Foundation and worked at Next Street, a social enterprise that drives equitable economic and community development. She currently serves on the steering committee of the Workforce Matters Funders Network.
